A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: Some of it was incredibly good. But so much awful destroyed the overall feeling. I went into this movie the morning it opened in France (Wednesday\, two days ahead of the worldwide opening) and had only heard great reviews. I was so excited. But when I walked out I was so confused\, thinking\, \"Really? Did we watch a different movie?\" I personally like change and new directions\, and I don't mind how they treated Luke's character. My issue is that the new characters and storylines are simply unengaging. I have no interest in any of it. Which is a shame because I'm a life-long Star Wars fan and really wanted to like these new movies. For the first time ever (with both Solo and Episode IX)\, I have no interest in watching upcoming instalments. Maybe if they make some Old Republic films or something\, or fast-forward a couple centuries. But whatever happens\, they're going to have to stop piggybacking off of the popularity of the Star Wars brand and actually be creative for once. It's been a very long time since someone wrote a good Star Wars story for the screen. About 35 years actually.
